posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
This exceptionally vexed halfling began his gestation back in November 2016 with this thread: Bullroarer Took, and anyone wanting to follow the discussion (including Tolkien-lore and the invention of golf, among other things) can do so there. The Bullroarer has now been fully tested in the OC/ Mines of Twin Summits and in Aielund. I went back and forth over whether to post him in this august forum, as you couldn't really call him "optimal" by any usual yardstick. He is, however, an absolute joy to play, and if we can't have a few builds here that are simply fun to play then it's a sorry state of affairs.

He was initially a concept and a challenge, and ended up a Barbarian, 'cos he's big and scary (for a Hin), Champion of Tulkas, 'cos he's their champion against the forces of evil, and Rogue, 'cos i) it avoids an xp penalty and ii) he gets full Tumble and UMD. But the clincher was that he should be STR-based. I understand from Valerfor that Grizzled Dwarlord constructed a Bullroarer back in 2006, but his was a Fighter/ Bard/ RDD wielding a bastard sword 2-handed. This one is very different. Now, I appreciate that reason has to be fairly flexible when creating a fictitious character in a separate and different fictitious world, but if we can't suspend disbelief, who on Oerth can?

[To avoid any potential copyright issues, I will hereby muddy the waters by saying he could equally be named after Midnight Oil's track "Bullroarer" from the album "Diesel and Dust" (excellent Aussie band, btw, and I highly commend the album). So there.]

I know, technically, he should have a club, but it's a 2-hander for halflings, and he really needed a shield, so I hope I can be forgiven for going with a mace instead. And yes, at least one of the Expertise girls would have made sense (particularly if you went for Taunt as well), but hey, we're talking about a very cross, lunatic hobbit who rides a pig full-tilt into battle - sense doesn't come into it.

Right, preamble out of the way, here he is...

Bandobras Took - "The Bullroarer"
Barbarian 28/ Champion of Tulkas 10/ Rogue 2
Hin: non-evil, non-lawful

Stats
STR 16 (32)
DEX 12
CON 14
WIS 8
INT 14
CHA 8

HPs: 568
AC: (naked) 22, (full plate) 30, (+ medium shield) 32
DR: 6/-
Speed: +10%
Saves: Fortitude 31, Will 21, Reflex 26. All +4 v spells, +2 v fear-type spells, +5 reflex v traps
Terrifying Rage: DC 55 +1d10
Greater Rage: x8 per day, 11 rounds per rage.
Sneak Attack: 1d6 [whoo!]
BAB: 30
AB: (max, melee) 46/ 41/ 36/ 31, (ranged) 32, (thrown) 33
Skills: 246. Disable Trap 3 (5), Discipline 43 (54), Intimidate 43 (55), Listen 43 (48), Open Lock 1 (2), Search 3 (5), Spellcraft (cc) 18 (20), Tumble 40 (41), UMD 34 (33). [Perfectly possible to grab Taunt in place of either Listen or Spellcraft with the assorted trapping bits and bobs, but I just wasn't feeling very "taunty"]

Levelling
1 B1: Heavy Armour Proficiency/ {Rage I/ Barbarian Speed}
2 B2: {Uncanny Dodge I}
3 B3: Weapon Focus: Mace
4 B4: STR+1 (17)
5 B5

Skills Schedule

Cheers

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
gkorjax wrote: ↑
Aug 13, 2021
But... I think this name is already in use, in a build by GDL.

Sent from my KFTRPWI using Tapatalk
I do mention GDL's build in the OP, and here it is: The Bull-Roarer. Given the wildly different interpretations (not one class shared), I didn't think there'd be any confusion, but I'll happily rename him here if you (or GDL) think it necessary. It's not as if he didn't have enough names/ nicknames to spare.

Cheers
